result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Angela S Welhouse was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Angela S Welhouse was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STRAIGHT TIME.
AMENDED 06-01-2015:  Balance of sentence may be served with Huber (all standard release conditions INCLUDING medical care/treatment).  Commencing forthwith.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.    Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Oconomowoc Police Department.  Transcript fee ($12) to be forwarded to District Attorney's Office.  All are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the victims listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a vehicle without a valid license.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber with all Standard Release Conditions).
Apply 67 days credit.
Last 30 days to be served through the Day Report Program.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angela S Welhouse in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Joseph Smith.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 2 & 5.
Court finds the Defendant Guilty of both counts 2 & 5.
Counts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed as read-ins.
Counts 6 & 7 are dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
Count 2:
1 Year in the Waukesha County Jail Straight-Time.
Stayed

Term of Probation:  24 Months
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victims listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Defendant not posses any weapons.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Oconomowoc Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $12 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
Fine:  $2,202
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

6 Years D/L REVOCATION
6 Years IGNITION INTERLOCK

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

CONDITION TIME:
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
67 Days Credit    
Last 30 Days to be served through the Day Report Program

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.





Count: 5
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail Straight-Time.
Consecutive to Count 2
Stayed.

Term of Probation: 24 Months
Conditions of Probation:
Same as on count 2.
Court orders the Electronic Weapon seized forfeited and can be destroyed pursuant to statute by the holding agency.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Defendant Angela S Welhouse in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
